issue.title: Unable to cross compile liboqs for windows in ubuntu 18.04
issue.body:
Followed instructions on https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/wiki/Platform-specific-notes-for-building-liboqs#cross-compiling-on-debianubuntu-linux-for-windows and also installed dependencies mentioned in https://openquantumsafe.org/liboqs/getting-started.html for ubuntu . But i get compile error.
![compileerror](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82881725/175820155-d2d64247-342f-4397-842e-cc73e7be5a21.png)

comment.body: Thanks for letting me know. So it also did not work without disabling Picnic on your machine?

issue.title: improve Windows crosscompile handling
issue.body:
(Partially) fixing #1235

Drawbacks currently: 
- Disables all CPU optimizations for Windows cross-builds
- Does not fix build problems with SIKE

Further suggestions for improvements welcome (@christianpaquin ?). Draft mode until agreement on resolving the drawbacks.

* [no] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [no] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

comment.body: SIKE issue may be resolved by #1231 and CPU optimizations can be enabled by an on-platform build (and [suitable wiki](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/wiki/Platform-specific-notes-for-building-liboqs#cross-compiling-on-debianubuntu-linux-for-windows) statement added). Thus marking PR as ready for review.

issue.title: adding scan-build test
issue.body:
Fixes #1239. Avoid recurrence of #1212 (which arguably should be re-opened).

@dstebila : Please decide how/when to merge this. My suggestion would be after @sebastinas and @bhess had a chance to review the [run log](https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/github/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/17515/output/103/0?file=true&allocation-id=62bb17df947e861ada3206ce-0-build%2F54D6229E) for the picnic and kyber issues listed.

* [no] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [no] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

comment.body: Thanks for adding the check. I opened a PR in Kyber upstream, the reported nonce update isn't necessary.

> collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status

Prior to that, I have built liboqs library sucessfully using these commands: 
```
mkdir build && cd build
cmake -GNinja .. 
ninja 
```
Running the complete test suite using the command `ninja run_tests` was succesful. 

I had an issue with running the compile command eailer but it was 'fixed' by setting the default compiler to gcc (`export cc=gcc`) #1230 

I'm using Ubuntu 20.04.3 LTS

issue.title: Windows-msys2 build failing on picnic
issue.body: There's a recurring [CI error](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/dstebila/liboqs/builds/43744511/job/4f372pki566y29s9) on main branch that's apparently now also holding #1210. Who knows about/looks after that environment? @christianpaquin ? Or shall we drop this? Anyone using this? But then again, the consistent error message about an array index error in picnic may be worth while checking out...

comment.body: @sebastinas thanks for your interest in getting involved with Picnic issues we find. What's your preference on this issue then: Do you want to look into this/provide a solution or shall we close/drop/disregard it?

issue.title: adding scan-build test
issue.body:
Fixes #1239. Avoid recurrence of #1212 (which arguably should be re-opened).

@dstebila : Please decide how/when to merge this. My suggestion would be after @sebastinas and @bhess had a chance to review the [run log](https://circleci.com/api/v1.1/project/github/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/17515/output/103/0?file=true&allocation-id=62bb17df947e861ada3206ce-0-build%2F54D6229E) for the picnic and kyber issues listed.

* [no] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [no] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

comment.body: A fix for Picnic is available in #1241.
